evidence.text: Spectrum Leasing Corp. v. United States, 764 F.2d 891, 895 (D.C. Cir. 1985)
Ingersoll-Rand Co. v. United States, 780 F.2d 74, 77 (D.C. Cir. 1985)
Transohio Sav. Bank v. Dir., Off. of Thrift Supervision, 967 F.2d 598, 609 (D.C. Cir. 1992)

NOTICE OF APPEAL TO DC CIRCUIT COURT as to 48 Order on Motion to Dismiss,, Order on Motion to Certify Class,, Order on Motion for Preliminary Injunction, 47 Memorandum & Opinion, by CENTER FOR CHILDREN & YOUTH JUSTICE, CHINESE FOR AFFIRMATIVE ACTION, FORCE DETROIT, HEALTH RESOURCES IN ACTION, VERA INSTITUTE OF JUSTICE.

extracted.value: Appeal: CENTER FOR CHILDREN & YOUTH JUSTICE, CHINESE FOR AFFIRMATIVE ACTION, FORCE DETROIT, HEALTH RESOURCES IN ACTION, VERA INSTITUTE OF JUSTICE appealed to DC Circuit Court.

evidence.text: ORDER. For the reasons set forth in the court's 47 Memorandum Opinion, Plaintiffs' 3 Motion for Preliminary Injunction is denied and Defendants' 27 Motion to Dismiss is granted. Plaintiffs' 2 Motion to Certify Class is denied as moot.

extracted.value: On July 7, 2025, the court denied Plaintiffs' Motion for Preliminary Injunction, granted Defendants' Motion to Dismiss, and denied the Motion to Certify Class as moot.

evidence.text: ORDER granting in part and denying in part Plaintiffs' 51 Emergency Motion for Injunction Pending Appeal. The parties shall file a Joint Status Report by September 29, 2025, which updates the court on the status of appellate proceedings, including whether the court of appeals has granted emergency relief or expedited review.

extracted.value: On July 21, 2025, the court granted in part and denied in part Plaintiffs' Emergency Motion for Injunction Pending Appeal, requiring a Joint Status Report by September 29, 2025.

evidence.text: MOTION to Certify Class by CHILDREN AND YOUTH JUSTICE CENTER, CHINESE FOR AFFIRMATIVE ACTION, FORCE DETROIT, HEALTH RESOURCES IN ACTION, VERA INSTITUTE OF JUSTICE.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Motion to Certify Class on May 21, 2025, seeking class certification for their claims.

evidence.text: MOTION for Preliminary Injunction by CHILDREN AND YOUTH JUSTICE CENTER, CHINESE FOR AFFIRMATIVE ACTION, FORCE DETROIT, HEALTH RESOURCES IN ACTION, VERA INSTITUTE OF JUSTICE.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Motion for Preliminary Injunction on May 22, 2025, seeking a preliminary injunction to prevent the termination of grant funding.

evidence.text: MOTION to Dismiss by PAMELA J. BONDI, MAUREEN A. HENNEBERG, OFFICE OF JUSTICE PROGRAMS, U.S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE.

extracted.value: Defendants filed a Motion to Dismiss on June 9, 2025, seeking dismissal of the complaint.

evidence.text: EMERGENCY MOTION for Injunction Pending Appeal by CENTER FOR CHILDREN & YOUTH JUSTICE, CHINESE FOR AFFIRMATIVE ACTION, FORCE DETROIT, HEALTH RESOURCES IN ACTION, VERA INSTITUTE OF JUSTICE.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed an Emergency Motion for Injunction Pending Appeal on July 10, 2025, seeking to prevent re-obligation of terminated grant funding pending appeal.

evidence.text: For those reasons, the court denies preliminary injunctive relief and grants Defendants' pending motion to dismiss. As the court denies preliminary relief and dismisses this action, it also denies the pending motion for class certification as moot.
